meanings.definition: A set of parallel yarns in a loom through which the weft is passed.
meanings.sent1: The sleys on the loom were neatly arranged in parallel lines.
meanings.sent2: The weaver threaded the weft through the sleys to create the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten thought the sleys on the loom were a fun obstacle course.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts moved through her mind like the weft through the sleys, weaving a tapestry of memories.
meanings.sent5: The gleaming threads of the sleys shimmered in the sunlight, inviting touch and admiration.

meanings.sent1: The boat sleys through the calm waters of the lake.
meanings.sent2: She sleys gracefully across the dance floor, gliding with elegance.
meanings.sent3: The skateboarder sleys down the ramp with effortless skill.
meanings.sent4: Time sleys forward, carrying us along its steady current.
meanings.sent5: His words sleys through the conversation, making his point clearly and effectively.
